text: Despite what you see in legal dramas, judges presiding over divorce and custody disputes are reluctant in real life to tell parents how to parent their kids, family law experts say. They certainly don ’ t like to threaten a parent with a loss of custody rights unless they have serious concerns about how that parent is conducting him or herself. For that reason, a judge ’ s reported rebuke of Angelina Jolie and his ruling that she ’ s at risk of losing primary custody of her six children to Brad Pitt is remarkable, according to Christopher Melcher, a Los Angeles - based family law attorney who has worked with a number or high - profile clients. “ The court generally expects parents to make the best decisions for their children and family, but when a parent is proving they ’ re not acting in that way, the court will start imposing sanctions
